org.dockbox.selene.domain.table

Class Table

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dockbox.selene.domain.table.Table

  • public class Table
extends java.lang.Object
    A relational table type which can easily create weak relations to other tables. Relations are non-strict references so either table can be disposed of without affecting the origin.

    Each table has a final set of column identifiers indicating their structure. Tables contain TableRows which can only be added if the row has the same identifiers as the table. If a row has more, less, or mismatching column idenfitiers it cannot be added to the table.

    Column identifiers are unique and should be implementations of ColumnIdentifier with a generic type indicating the data type.

    Since:
    feature/S124
    Author:
    Simbolduc, GuusLieben

    • Constructor Detail

      • Table

        public Table(ColumnIdentifier<?>... columns)
        Instantiates a new Table with a given set of column identifiers. These identifiers cannot be modified later unless a select action is performed, creating a split copy of this table instance.
        Parameters:
        columns - The column identifiers

      • Table

        public Table(java.util.Collection<ColumnIdentifier<?>> columns)

    • Method Detail

      • addRow

        public void addRow(java.lang.Object object)
        Generates a TableRow from a given object based on the objects Fields. By default the field name is used to look up a matching column identifier which is present inside the table. If the field is annotated with Property the contained ColumnIdentifier is used instead.

        If the field is annotated with Ignore the field will not be converted to a column entry in the row. One attempt will be made to make the field accessible if it is not already.

        Parameters:
        object - Object to "try to" add as a row to the table
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When a field cannot be accessed or cast correctly. Contains the causing Exception as the cause.
        UnknownIdentifierException - When no column identifier could be found or generated, or when there are not enough fields present to satiate the column identifiers present in this table.

      • getIdentifier

        @Nullable
public @Nullable ColumnIdentifier getIdentifier(@NonNls
                                                           java.lang.String fieldName)
                                                    throws java.lang.ClassCastException
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassCastException

      • addRow

        public void addRow(java.lang.Object... values)
        Generates a TableRow from a given set of objects. The objects should be in the same order as the table's getIdentifiers(). If the data type of a object does not match up with its expected ColumnIdentifier a exception is thrown and the row is not inserted into the table.
        Parameters:
        values - Objects to "try to" add as rows to the table
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the amount of values does not meet the amount of column headers, or when the data type of the object does not match the expected type.

      • where

        public <T> Table where(ColumnIdentifier<T> column,
                       T filter)
        Filters the table's rows based on their value for a given ColumnIdentifier. If the value of the row at the given column matches the expected filter value the row is kept, otherwise it is ignored.

        Returns a new table with only the filtered rows. The origin table is not modified. Either table can be disposed of without affecting the other. Row references are shared between both tables.

        Type Parameters:
        T - Indicates the class that both the Identifier and the Filter must have
        Parameters:
        column - Indicates which column is used to search through the table
        filter - Indicates what value to search for
        Returns:
        Returns the new table with the filter applied
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When a row causes a IdentifierMismatchException. Typically this is never thrown unless changes were made from another thread.

      • join

        public <T> Table join(@NotNull
                      @NotNull Table otherTable,
                      ColumnIdentifier<T> column,
                      Merge merge)
               throws EmptyEntryException,
                      IdentifierMismatchException
        Overloaded method for join(Table, ColumnIdentifier, Merge, boolean). Empty entries will not be populated using this method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The data type of the column
        Parameters:
        otherTable - The other/foreign table
        column - The column to join on
        merge - The merge behavior
        Returns:
        A new table with the joined rows
        Throws:
        EmptyEntryException - Thrown if a entry is empty and cannot be populated
        IdentifierMismatchException - When a identifier does not exist across both tables

      • join

        public <T> Table join(@NotNull
                      @NotNull Table otherTable,
                      ColumnIdentifier<T> column,
                      Merge merge,
                      boolean populateEmptyEntries)
               throws EmptyEntryException,
                      IdentifierMismatchException
        Joins two tables based on a given ColumnIdentifier. Rows are joined together based on their value on the given column, if the values match the rows are joined together.

        Rows from the origin and the foreign table are merged into single rows. If a column exists in both tables, the Merge behavior indicates which to keep.

        If a row does not have a matching row in the other table while new columns are created, populateEmptyEntries indicates whether to treat this is a illegal state, or populate the entry with null.

        Type Parameters:
        T - The data type of the column
        Parameters:
        otherTable - The other/foreign table
        column - The column to join on
        merge - The merge behavior
        populateEmptyEntries - Whether or not empty entries should be populated (with null)
        Returns:
        A new table with the joined rows
        Throws:
        EmptyEntryException - Thrown if a entry is empty and cannot be populated
        IdentifierMismatchException - When a identifier does not exist across both tables

      • getIdentifiers

        public ColumnIdentifier<?>[] getIdentifiers()
        Gets the table's column identifiers.
        Returns:
        Return the table's identifiers

      • select

        public Table select(ColumnIdentifier<?>... columns)
        Selects only the given columns of a table. Returns a new table populated with all the rows in the origin table, but only with the columns provided.
        Parameters:
        columns - Indicates the columns to select
        Returns:
        Return the new table with only the selected columns

      • addRow

        public void addRow(TableRow row)
            throws IdentifierMismatchException
        Adds a row to the table if the column identifiers are equal in length and type. If the row has more or less column identifiers it is not accepted into the table. If a row has a column which is not contained in this table it is not accepted into the table.
        Parameters:
        row - The row object to add to the table
        Throws:
        IdentifierMismatchException - When there is a column mismatch between the row and the table

      • hasColumn

        public boolean hasColumn(ColumnIdentifier<?> column)
        Returns whether or not the table contains the given ColumnIdentifier.
        Parameters:
        column - The column
        Returns:
        Whether or not the column is present

      • first

        public Exceptional<TableRow> first()
        Attempts to get the first row in the table. If there is no value present, a Exceptional holding a IndexOutOfBoundsException will be returned.
        Returns:
        Return the first row of the table

      • last

        public Exceptional<TableRow> last()
        Attempts to get the last row in the table. If there is no value present, a Exceptional holding a IndexOutOfBoundsException will be returned.
        Returns:
        Return the last row of the table

      • count

        public int count()
        Gets the amount of rows present in the table.
        Returns:
        Return the table's row count

      • orderBy

        public <T extends java.lang.Comparable> void orderBy(ColumnIdentifier<T> column,
                                                     Order order)
        Orders (sorts) a table based on a given column. Requires the data type of the ColumnIdentifier to be a implementation of Comparable. This modifies the existing table.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type constraint indicating this method only accepts implementations of Comparable
        Parameters:
        column - Indicates the column to order by
        order - Indicates what way to order the table by
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the table does not contain the given column, or the data type is not a Comparable
